attributes.name: ai_literacy
attributes.description: Degree of technical understanding of AI systems, including how LLMs and machine learning work (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: prior_ai_tool_usage
attributes.description: Frequency of personal AI tool use before the ASI event (Never, Occasionally, Regularly, Power user).

attributes.name: occupation_automation_risk
attributes.description: Estimated degree to which the person's occupation is structurally redundant given ASI-level cognitive capability (0=immune, 1=fully redundant).

attributes.name: asi_belief
attributes.description: Whether the person believes the ASI demonstration is genuine and the claims are accurate (Fully believes, Skeptical but open, Dismisses as exaggeration, Conspiracy/hoax framing).

attributes.name: asi_emotional_valence
attributes.description: Dominant emotional orientation toward the ASI event and its implications (Excited/hopeful, Anxious/fearful, Ambivalent/uncertain, Indifferent, Angry/resentful).

attributes.name: personal_health_stake
attributes.description: Whether the person or an immediate household member has a serious illness that ASI-developed cures (cancer, Alzheimer's, ALS, diabetes, HIV) could directly address.

attributes.name: financial_resilience
attributes.description: Capacity to weather economic disruption from ASI-driven labor displacement, based on savings, assets, and income diversification (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: asi_governance_stance
attributes.description: Preferred policy stance on ASI development and deployment (Accelerate with minimal regulation, Light-touch oversight, Strong international governance, Immediate pause/moratorium, No opinion).

attributes.name: information_network_reach
attributes.description: Size and influence of the person's social information network — how many people they can reach with their views or actions (0=isolated, 1=highly networked/influential).

attributes.name: institutional_change_tolerance
attributes.description: Willingness to accept rapid, fundamental changes to existing social, economic, and political institutions driven by ASI (0=strongly resistant, 1=highly tolerant).

attributes.name: asi_adoption_intent
attributes.description: Stated intent to personally adopt and use publicly available ASI tools once released (Early adopter, Will try eventually, Wait and see, Reluctant/Forced, Refuses to use).

attributes.name: techno_optimism
attributes.description: Dispositional belief that technological progress leads to net positive outcomes for humanity (0–1 scale, independent of current AI views).

input.notes: Big Five already exist in base population — not re-included. Attributes are chosen to drive the key behavioral divergences in an ASI scenario: belief/denial of the event, emotional reactions, economic...[truncated]
